intro: Lachnostoma magdalenicum, commonly known as the Magdalena lichen, is a foliose lichen that thrives in cool, moist environments. It belongs to the family Parmeliaceae and is characterized by its greenish-gray thallus with distinct, elongated lobes. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship with algae, which provide photosynthetic energy while the fungal component offers structural support and protection. It is often found on bark and rock surfaces in temperate regions. Due to its slow growth and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a sensitive indicator of environmental health.
